website_summaries.verdict: The kid-friendly version of the excellent Amazon Fire HD 8 costs a lot more, but offers a big package of worthwhile extras for preteens.
pros: This low-cost tablet is good enough for most video, game, app and social needs, plus its onboard storage is expandable via microSD card
The Kids Edition includes a wealth of extras, including deep parental controls, a no-questions-asked two-year warranty and Amazon's excellent FreeTime Unlimited service
cons: The Kids Edition costs significantly more than the otherwise identical standard version
There are the same app store limitations as the other Amazon Fire tablets, and no kid is going to prefer this to a (much more expensive) iPad

customer_reviews.title: Still not perfect for car travel
customer_reviews.text: Bought it primarily to play downloaded movies for the kids on a long road trip since all the portable DVD players suck. Could not filter for downloaded shows. Disney movie downloads still required wi-fi. (WTH!?) Can not access intended downloaded movies from the child's profile. It's great at home... or if you pay for mobile wi-fi I suppose...
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan H.

customer_reviews.title: The free time is great! They have so many options to choose from
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these and let me start with parents if you're on the fence on if you should buy them or not.. JUST do it ! We've had these a total of 7 hours but i can already tell it's worth it ! The set up was a breeze ! The free time is great ! They have so many options to choose from. I downloaded youtube for kids and Netflix on my profile and easily added it to there's. So far I have no complaints!!
customer_reviews.author: alexa safron

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: We mainly use it for road trips and it works pretty well. I'm not a huge fan of how FreeTime by Amazon is layed out. It comes with a bunch of apps on the main screen. It makes it hard to filter what my son can play with. All the apps are kids friendly but my son can just click on one and download it. So now my son is obsessed with this motorcycle game that came preloaded. A new layout would fix the problem I think. The screen also goes black sometimes when watching downloaded Netflix videos. The only way to fix it is to force shut off the tablet and turn it back on.
customer_reviews.author: Jesi White

customer_reviews.title: Customer Support can be a nightmare
customer_reviews.text: The Tablet itself is not bad, but may God have mercy on you if you have to call Customer Support. I ran into a technical problem with the FreeTime browser and my Customer Support experience was a nightmare, easily the most painful customer support experience of my life (and I'm old, and a geek, so that is saying something). If your native language is English you may find it very difficult to understand the support reps (because theirs isn't). If your issue isn't something very simple then expect to take 1-2 hours with the first rep before they pass you over to the technical support group who can actually understand the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Gossett

customer_reviews.title: The kids apps will disappear...be prepared.
customer_reviews.text: Frustrating! Spent all kinds of time setting it up for my son, including downloading apps for him to play. Now, the apps have disappeared. They show as in his allowed content - and I can open/play them in my profile. We've re-booted, we've set up another child's profile - all to no avail. I have spent HOURS on this. A search of the web shows this has been a problem - FOR AT LEAST A YEAR AND HALF. Seriously??!!! Fix it Amazon or I'll be returning this ASAP. What a disappointing Christmas gift!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: babs1234

customer_reviews.title: Bought, tested, playback encryption errors offline, returned.  Simple
customer_reviews.text: Had a 4 year old Samsung tablet. Limited space and apps so tried the new Amazon Fire 8. A bit slow but seemed good for travel. Downloaded vidoes for my son to watch while on travel. Doesn't play after the first day. Decryption and key error. Called support, transferred to tech support. End of discussion. It's going back and I will get the new Samsung tablet. I don't have the time or patience for faulty, slow and buggy software.
customer_reviews.author: Jin

customer_reviews.title: Lego Boost, How to set it up.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it, just for Lego Boost Works great! Step 1. Register and update all Kindle Patches to latest (takes a few reboots) Step 2. Sideload Google Play Store (search how on google) Step 3. Download official Lego Boost App from Google Play Step 4. Lock down the tablet with password protection, so the kids can't accidentally purchase from GP Store. Step 5. enable bluetooth to work with Lego finished
customer_reviews.author: wuber

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 4 year old grandson in late August. It's Oct. 28 and it won't even turn on. He used it a total of 12 times and now nothing. This stays at my house so I know it wasn't thrown around roughly. I'll have to send it back. Arrrgghh
customer_reviews.author: lane

customer_reviews.title: Not able to replace a faulty piece- disappointed with customer service.
customer_reviews.text: The tablet was great, my 4 year old son loved it, but now it has stopped working. It is not broken or damaged. It just stopped charging and now it wont start. I purchased it in November 2017. The description says they will replace it if something goes wrong within 2 years, but when I contacted Amazon today, the customer rep gave me the postal address of Amazon Services at Seattle! No phone number, No email, just an address. Is this a joke? How am I supposed to contact them? Write a letter? Amazon has always been great with customer service but I am very disappointed this time.
customer_reviews.author: RKS

customer_reviews.title: Very limited functionality
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with this tablet. I did not realize that you were limited to Amazon's "environment" with a fire tablet. You are limited to what apps you can install, nowhere near the selection of Apple or Google. The tech support rep seemed to have no idea that this was the case either. He kept insisting that a youtube viewer developed by someone named "work4mob" was published by youtbe. I am sure it works fine otherwise, but you should know this going in. I am returning mine. As always, Amazon was great about the return.
customer_reviews.author: Britt DePriest

customer_reviews.title: Freetime Feature is Horrible
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this tablet, but the free time for my daughter is beyond restrictive. She cannot watch streaming apps Hulu or Netflix because free time prevents such applications from running even with my override commands. The front facing camera is cheap low quality that take poor quality pictures. Web Browser doesn't allow overriding and constantly has errors. For this price, I should have bought a Samsung Galaxy Tablet and put my own kid friendly bumper with insurance. I do not recommend this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: SierraTheWolfe

customer_reviews.title: this would be the best kids tablet hands down
customer_reviews.text: 2 big things kill this tablet for kids. You can enable and install apps from unknown sources and install them but FreeTime will not let you see them. FreeTime also blocks programs from saving to the external SD card. This means that PLEX won't be able to sync to the external SD card as well as Netflix or any other. However, Amazon makes sure it's available to their apps. If Amazon would remove these restrictions, this would be the best kids tablet hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Annoyed
customer_reviews.text: Terrible coustiner service. We have only had the tablet about two weeks and already having charging issues with it. When I called coustomer service there only soulutiin was to re boot and restart the system then to "keep an eye on how we insert the charger" They said to call. Ack if that doesn't fix the problem
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: I love that all of the apps
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old daughter LOVES her tablet. It comes with one year of "free time," which includes a lot of books. I love that all of the apps, videos and books are age appropriate. I like the parental controls. The only thing that is a BIT disappointing is that some of the apps she had (with an old IPAD that died) are not available on here...ie- Minecraft, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: This thing sucks.
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely worthless, we made the mistake of buying two, one for both kids. Not only do they not have a similar operating system to android, apps are almost impossible to find or use. We have had them for less than one month, and they won't hold a charge. So I have an expensive useless brick. I went to the store and bought an unlocked Samsung J3 as a replacement for my kids. Does the stuff this thing was suppose to do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The crack was so bad she couldn’t use it all
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our Daughter for Christmas and after only a week of having it she cracked the screen. The crack was so bad she couldn’t use it all. Of course we were super upset, so we went ahead and just purchased another. We got an email a week later saying that the warranty covered any type of damage no questions asked. Say what?!?! Haha. So the warranty is amazing for little ones. They did in fact refund us for the second one we bought and we just sent back the broken one. Plus she loves the think. All kinds of free books and educational apps. Totally worth the money!! We’re super satisfied with warranty and product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good tablet for young children
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good tablet for young children. Good screen size, easy to navigate, parental controls are well integrated. It is fast enough for the apps that the kids use. The glass is easy to clean. Unfortunately, I needed to use the no questions asked warranty twice. Fortunately, the warranty lives up to its name and a replacement was shipped to me the same day that my broken one arrived at Amazon. If your kids (or you) are rough on your electronics, this warranty will pay for itself.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Worked GREAT...Until it DIDN'T.
customer_reviews.text: It's a GREAT tablet 9when it worked). BUT...I was just informed that it stopped holding a charge, a couple of months ago. They tried every cord and new cords, but couldn't get it to charge. Now I have to get the tablet and send it back and get a new one (annoying process). It's a nice that you can get it replaced, but we had such a hard time getting it set up - that I'm not looking forward to that process again. Just wish things would work like they should. A tablet should work longer than 1 1/2 months.
customer_reviews.author: LoveLabs

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tablet for my daughters 2nd birthday. We do limited screen time and this tablet is just perfect. It has amazing apps geared towards her age and the PBS videos are great! I love playing an educational game with her and watching a fun little show. It comes in handy when I have to put her baby brother to bed also and she need a little distraction so she isn't climbing into everything else. I highly recommend this tablet and couldn't be more pleased. I will come back and post an update in a couple months!
customer_reviews.author: Lopez

customer_reviews.title: In-App purchases like Endless reader are not accessible. No YouTubeKids
customer_reviews.text: In-App purchases (i.e. unlocking kid favorite apps like Endless Reader) are not accessible to the kid's profile. YouTube Kids app is not available. Software is buggy, within minutes we already had an app that was playing music and would not quit despite launching other apps with audio. Wifi drops from full signal to nothing. Loading videos from files was slightly confusing, and now I have to teach my kid how to use VLC.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: Excellent purchase for anyone with young kids We previously had the fire 7 for my daughter but it was too slow, clunky, constantly freezing and not enough memory. For the extra $20, the fire 8 is well worth it. It has tons of memory to store Netflix downloads and other apps. The battery holds a long time. I love the 2 year guarantee. I still don’t love the free time app, it’s so slow and not very user friendly. However for the main purpose we need it for, which is Netflix on the go, it’s an excellent buy I’d definitely recommend to others, especially if you don’t want to buy a pricey iPad
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware! Better yet, buyer don't dare!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this faulty device for my 3 year old's Christmas gift and didn't even last a month! The screen went black and the device won't turn on. I contacted Amazon's customer service who insists that it needs to be charged... as if it would not have occurred to me to ever charge the device. Then they ask me to turn on the device that hasn't turned on for the past week. I recommend Amazon scrapping the device as they clearly are not up to par with the operating system or level of customer service required to support the shortcomings of what's on today's market. Absolute waste!
customer_reviews.author: Clysia R. McFall

customer_reviews.title: not great - the Amazon limitations on it really make it ...
customer_reviews.text: We pre-ordered this for my son, who loves being on tablets/cell phones, and I wanted something with protection. It's worked "OK", not great - the Amazon limitations on it really make it feel like a dumbed down tablet, which in terms of hardware it isn't, but the software limitations sometimes can kill the experience. So far it has survived rough handling and liquid spills just fine. P.S. You can, with determination, install the App Store and YouTube and YouTube Kids on it. Google it.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Aragon

customer_reviews.title: Could use a few upgrades on this!
customer_reviews.text: I like that it is pre-loaded with videos, apps & books... BUT it would make sense that those videos play without Wi-Fi.. THEY DON'T, AND THAT SUCKS!!. Also, the screen seems a little dim even when at highest brightness. Should have had a stand on the back if the case & screen protector! They should have have parents input on this one. 🤔
customer_reviews.author: Athletic Mom

customer_reviews.title: My kid has used it on and off for over a year
customer_reviews.text: I don't like all the add-ons tbh. I prefer a stock android tablet with no bloat. This reminds me of buying a nook. where the interface is too customized. I wish it came with the google store by default so i could port my existing purchases easier. those points aside the bumper has protected the unit from my child dropping it, throwing it in a backpack etc. It seems to have held up to this. While it has not taken direct hits to the center of the screen it seems to do well. I only use tablets on trips and as such has never seen daily abuse, but airport and long car trip abuse is usually pretty on par.
customer_reviews.author: sah26

customer_reviews.title: No music for kids??
customer_reviews.text: The tablet does not allow playing/uploading music into the child profile. We can have books, videos, games, apps, but NO MUSIC?? We purchased the Kindle mostly for music, and I can't use the Amazon Music Unlimited subscription on it. Now I have to figure out an app workaround to make this work. Very disappointing. Amazon, please fix this and add a Music category - kids love their music!!
customer_reviews.author: Monica T

customer_reviews.title: No way to block all apps or books at once
customer_reviews.text: Although technically, this tablet is wonderful, I don't like the idea that by 5 yr can be distracted with so many apps and books. There doesn't seem to be a feature to block all allowing me to hand pick each app/book that is at his disposal. I've gone into parental controls and set the age down to 2 yrs yet there are still over 4500 apps and books that I would have to individually select to block. If anyone knows of a better way, I'm all ears.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: this is an amazing product from the content they offer through amazon freetime ...
customer_reviews.text: this is an amazing product from the content they offer through amazon freetime to the ease of use of parental controls. Finally a tablet for kids where you don't have to worry about in app purchases, no inappropriate content and so much educational apps!!. This is a tablet where kids can use for many years to come. Since the day I gave it to my kids, they never asked for their old tablet back, they love how they can access apps without asking for password every single time. Thank you Amazon. it is a really great product and I love how you can sign out of your kids account and it becomes a great tablet for adults with Amazing Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like the concept
customer_reviews.text: Like the concept, but there are quirks in the functionality. I am displeased that you can't transfer Amazon Prime content you can watch from adult mode to kids mode. Can't figure out the rationale behind this policy. Perfect for streaming when wifi is available, but wish downloads of Amazon Prime content could be used in kids mode. would make our long car rides much more pleasant. the user face is not as seamless as ios. That said, you get a lot more memory in a much more affordable package. Apps like Netflix and Disney Anywhere allow downloads to be viewed in kids mode (bonus), but more menus upon menus to work around.
customer_reviews.author: junebugmama

customer_reviews.title: Dooped...Tablet Stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: My three stars is for the false advertising of 2-yr worry free guarantee/warranty. My order log says I’m past the warranty but clearly shows I purchased less than 2 yrs ago. It’s a good tablet until it’s not. I’m paying for Freetime subscription and no one can use the tablet bcuz it won’t charge and just flickers if and on of and on when plugged into the charger. I have tried hard lowering of and on, holding down the power button for 10, 20, even 60 seconds. No help. I’ve used different charging ports, usb only ports, power surge protectors, laptops, computers... nothing has gotten this thing to work. If anyone can help, I’m all ears but I feel dooped
customer_reviews.author: Nyla

customer_reviews.title: No screen lock for kids mode while playing a video
customer_reviews.text: pretty big miss that the kid's mode does not allow you to lock the screen while a video is being played. Likely returning and going with Apple.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: My daughter is 3 and is IN LOVE with her new tablet
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 3 and is IN LOVE with her new tablet. So far she hasn't been able to break it and it's been dropped a few times. The first time you try to open an app it takes a while to get it downloaded and going but once you do every time after is pretty quick. I just made sure all the apps I knew my daughter would beeline towards were loaded the night before she got it. With the 1 year subscription it comes with there is sooo much content. It is nearly overwhelming the amount of items ready to go. I LOVE that it has an adult mode and a separate child profile.
customer_reviews.author: Pampered Linny

customer_reviews.title: Made intentionally lousy by Amazon's competition with Google
customer_reviews.text: Because of a silly competition between Amazon and Google you cannot use YouTube in any fashion. Even as an advanced user I found it incredibly hard to get YouTube to work in the Freetime section of the tablet. Many people have written instructions on how to sideload it into Freetime but Amazon has done everything they can to block you from using it. This is petty rivalry at its finest at the expense of Amazon's customers and frankly I don't feel like I want to be an Amazon Customer anymore. This was my daughter's birthday present and she won't even pick it up she'd rather play with the first generation iPad this was intended to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Best. Kids. Tablet. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: Dear fellow parents: This tablet rocks. I read the reviews prior to ordering this, and everyone is correct. it's fantastic. My kids (3 and 4) love it! I love it because it's locked up like Ft. Knox! They can only play what is age appropriate and we can even set a timer and it shuts off when time is up! It's safe and durable. It's already been hit in frustration, thrown as a weapon, and stepped on by the 60 lb dog. Even if any of those things had killed it it comes with a no questions asked warranty!!!!! Honestly, you'd be silly not to get this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: gwoman8920

customer_reviews.title: Problem with charging port
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter loves her kindle this is the second one we've bought her but it all of a sudden does not want to charge it's a problem with the charging port I did look up on google and found this is a known problem I'm hoping Amazon will replace this free of charge, she is not the only one in the home that has a kindle i have 2 myself and love them I have my original black and white then I also have a kindle fire and am going to get the newest one for my birthday this year not because anything is wrong I just want a larger screen ,kindle makes awesome products so hopefully I hear back
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie Stone (george stone amazon account holder)

customer_reviews.title: Far exceeded my expectations!
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughters (pages 3 and 6) LOVE their Fire tablets and I love that they have access to unlimited age-appropriate games, books and videos and can choose to download whatever is there. I don't have to worry about in-app purchases or games that encourage buying more and more games. They have never watched commercial TV and have always played games and videos on my IPad, so I couldn't resist the deal for two of these tablets. The surprise was the content and ease of use even for old grandma to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Janis

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working on Xmas - but quick fix
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas present. I actually purchased three for my three children. One stopped working on Christmas Day - just turned off. No reason. Tried multiple chargers and multiple outlets. It wasn't dropped or anything - just stopped working. Since I purchased it 2 months ago, I have no rights to a return or technical help. Frustrating. They should have some sort of exception for Christmas gifts. On a side note, the other two are great and working well. **I changed this review due to having immediate contact about troubleshooting my issue. I actually looked myself and figured out how to fix it through online troubleshooting research.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Hare

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the heartache/trouble.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the pink one from Amazon last year for Christmas for my daughter.. I have factory reset this thing umpteen million times. Extremely unhappy that her "gift from Santa" was such a HUGE disappointment. And to make things worse- we took it away for good because we got tired of her getting mad at, or at us for it not working. Constantly glitches/messes up. We didnt allow more than 10 apps on this tablet for the longest time to try to help with the freezing and glitching (volume is included) and it STILL had issues. It's has a "mind of its own". Garbage. Maybe "Santa" wont bring her something broken this year :(
customer_reviews.author: MomminAintEasyX2

customer_reviews.title: Charging connection.
customer_reviews.text: We have had to send this back. It was replaced with s refurbished one but the sane problems continued to come up with the replacement. Charging issues. The charging cords do not fit snug past the first couple of weeks. Eventually it won’t make a connection and charge at all. I thought it was the cord but the fact that it stopped charging at all leads me to believe it is the Kindle itself. But the kids love them so there is not another option.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE the soft case around this Kindle
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 2 pack for my 8 year old twin daughters. They previously had a tablet from Verizon and have had multiple issues with it not to mention the screen are a cracked. I LOVE the soft case around this Kindle. LOVE the size of the screen. I am not techy and have no patience for programming new gadgets, this was the easiest thing ever. Literally was able to hand these off to the kids for use in just a couple minutes. I used my email address and now these tablets are part of my account, which means I can see everything they do on them. They have a great battery life. Definitely worth the money!!!
customer_reviews.author: shaunareed

customer_reviews.title: Freetime Unlimited but limited...
customer_reviews.text: Got it yesterday. Getting used to it since I am an Apple user. It's very nice but disappointed on the Freetime Unlimited which is not accessible outside the U.S. Amazon should fix this because we all pay good money for the device. Other than that very pleased with it. Will have to get my toddler to test it to see how it performs in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Melina

customer_reviews.title: FreeTime isn't helpful to us and so if I were to buy again, I would just buy an ordinary Fire HD 8 instead.
customer_reviews.text: The tablet is built just like other Amazon tablets that have served my son well, but after using the previous tablets without restrictions, FreeTime is too restrictive. For better or worse, my son wants Youtube, and then netflix and those aren't anywhere close to getting into Amazon's walled garden that is called FreeTime. We use this as an ordinary Fire tablet and aren't taking advantage of the specials features of FreeTime. The warranty is nice, but if I had to do it again, I probably would have saved some money and bought the regular version of the Fire HD8.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Gibb

customer_reviews.title: There are usability issues.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 3.5 year old, and it has frustrating parts. It has great all you can eat catalog online but there is no way for a parent to curate the apps and games. The store is not a separate app, it offers too much choice for young child. It allows limited number of video downloads for offline mode but while offline all catalog is visible despite it cannot be reached, frustrating for a child. They need to let parents curate what they think relevant for their child and also hide online content while in offline mode.
customer_reviews.author: Emre Aydinceren

customer_reviews.title: A must for every kid.
customer_reviews.text: We have ipads for the kids.. yes ipad works and is a lot better. But this kindle for kids come with too many perks that we cant afford not to have. Alot of apps.. games and movies for the kids. Plus a serious warranty and protection from the abuse of children daily usage. I think as a parent.. every kids should be using this type of kindle. Its safe you money fro buying screen protector.. buyinh cases and screen glass replacement. And did i mention the warranty also warrant damage from drops and water?
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is
customer_reviews.text: You can turn off the blue light on the parental side, but cannot on the child's side. Cumbersome to download movies for the kids. Not all apps or videos let you download for offline content use/viewing. 24 books or apps seems to be the limit and it won't let you download more. Disappointed in the type of and amount of app content available on the children's side and the app store. We have a ton of Google Play movies, but can't watch them on the tablet due to the Amazon vs. Google war, which sucks. I honestly expected a bit more from this... oh, and I wish they came with a Purple, Green, Red and Orange case option.
customer_reviews.author: LBTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t Play Music in Child Profile
customer_reviews.text: Cannot load music or allow access to prime music for Child Profile. Every smart device in the world allows music playback! Letting our son browse and play back music on his own device rather than my old iPhone was the main point of this purpose. Don’t other kids listen to music?
customer_reviews.author: Thaddeus C. Letnes

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids!
customer_reviews.text: Cannot say enough about how wonderful this tablet is... bought it for my 3 yo in 2017. It came filled with games, learning activities and books. The warranty is no joke either, I’m here 15 months later getting a FREE replacement because my now 4 year old shattered the screen! I received great customer support and have never had a problem. This purchase was a no brainer, especially less than half the price of an ipad! Look no further for your destructive child’s tablet than right here!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey c Phillips

customer_reviews.title: honestly its not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item more than a year ago and at first it was amazing.. I love the features and all the access my daughter had. She was having fun! Not even 3 months in for some reason the games wouldn't load.. an error would pop in and an it also the storage was full so i thought iit was that. I bought the memory additional and when it came as soon as i put it in the problem was not solved at all. It would not read the memory card.. Long story short I ended it tossing in a corner and say bye bye to the money I spent. Had to buy her a new tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Yainara

customer_reviews.title: 2 defective ones so far beware
customer_reviews.text: I am now on our 3rd one as the first 2 were defective. 1st one worked great for about three weeks then shut off with 92% battery remaining. Contacted kindle support they verified it was defective and sent a replacement. The second one froze on the home screen after 2 days and I couldn't get it to turn off or reboot, contacted amazon again and they sent another replacement. Waiting on it to arrive. If the third time isn't a charm I'm returning for a refund and it's such a shame because when it actually works it's an excellent device that my kid loves but the whole process has been a real hassle!
customer_reviews.author: Rusty

customer_reviews.title: Teaching Tool
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as an upgrade to the kindle 6. She immediately began learning from this tablet. She has learned so much from this tablet that the teacher had to comment on how much she knows. I told her that the complement goes to my child and Kindle Free-time learning tablet. I told her I watched her go from potty training with Daniel Tiger to tracing letters and counting. She went into kindergarten already knowing what most other children needed to learn by the end of the school year. She received awards and outstanding grades in reading, math and language arts. I tell everyone I know to purchase this tablet for their school age child.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Just :(
customer_reviews.text: When we first got this tablet my daughter couldn’t use it because it kept kicking her out of the apps every time she would touch the screen, so we put it up and let her use the old iPad. Months later and she finally started using it again and there is a HUGE delay in anything she does. She can’t play games, she can’t color on her ABCmouse app, or pause videos because it takes almost half a minute for the tablet to catch up to what she is trying to do. I wish we would have figured this out sooner. Also, the battery life is terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla L

customer_reviews.title: Tablet is great, FreeTime has frustrating limitation
customer_reviews.text: The Kindle Fires themselves are great. Our daughter has had one for 3 years and it's still going strong, so we just bought this newest version for our 10yo son. He loves it. The free year of FreeTime Unlimited has given him access to so many books, apps, and shows which is really fun. My only complaint is a limitation of FreeTime itself. You can't enable location-based services in FreeTime so any apps that require that won't work. My son can't use his new Kindle to run the LEGO Boost app, for instance. I'd have to let him use my adult profile, which rather defeats the purpose of the kids version!
customer_reviews.author: Tara Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not usable
customer_reviews.text: This product is not user friendly. It is impossible to find downloaded content to be able to watch offline. There is no feature to lock the touch screen so when you finally do find a downloaded show for a screaming toddler to watch in the car, the second she touches the screen she backs out of it, never to be found again. I thought I'd finally figured some things out with it, then they sent an update and now no content is viewable at all offline, even content downloaded and paid for. I'm better off buying a regular tablet like a surface and just letting her use it with supervision.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth M.

customer_reviews.title: Great iPad by Amazon just for kids. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Bought our first one when my daughters other one quit working and was easy to set up love the free play for kids and the option to have a kids and adults account seperate. Bought a second one for our youngest and they are a life saver. She prefers the free cartoons and I love they are all educational and age group appropriate. Only down side is the videos are only good for 48 HRS of watch time and then have to be Re downloaded or different ones put on. Other than that lots of apps games, videos, and books for your little ones to enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Turns kids into Zombies. Works as intended.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is addicted to her Fire tablet. She's 3. If I let her have it all day, she would stay on it ALL DAY. It's actually scary how much of a zombie she turns into when she has her tablet. Seriously, monitor your kids on these things. They'll forsake all of their other toys for this if you let them. That being said, she can navigate through it really well, and it's a great distraction for times when I need her to sit still and stay off the floor for a few minutes, like when I'm trying to mop. It's also been thrown across the room by the toddler a couple of times, and has survived.
customer_reviews.author: Vwelyn

customer_reviews.title: The first ever tablet for my kid!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this tablet for my kid because he has to do work on educational apps which are given from school!! this is the first ever electronic we purchased for the son! I am amazingly surprise with quality of the product and its so worth of the price also. I am very happy it has parental control as well as kid friendly user interface. Kids can easily operate. It has kindle access. Kids can read e-books. Kids can play educational games as well as kids games. It has front and rear camera also. My son loves to take pictures. My son love it. I would like to buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: MVSP

customer_reviews.title: Decent tablet except broken by software.
customer_reviews.text: Works well as a kids tablet. The subscription service is good as well and had a lot of content that keeps my son entertained. I would give 4 or 5 stars except there is a bug with the software the gets an "oops, something went wrong" alert. Which requires a reset. The tablet is semi frozen for a bit before this error comes up. This wasn't present when we first got the tablet. It had been going on to long without an update/fix and creates a issues since my son can't fix it himself.
customer_reviews.author: B E

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice but some flaws with the clunky interface.
customer_reviews.text: Nice tablet but cumbersome interface. Love that I bought two of these and the kids can access their profile on either one. Downloads are slow. My kids prefer the iPad hands down. Much easier to access sprout and noggin. I like the parental controls but don't enjoy the interface and having to switch back and forth between profiles. Haven't figured out how to get apps like noggin for kids' profiles. I thought that was an option before this purchase and now it doesn't seem to be the case. Unfortunate that I pay for content on that app but cannot access it. Also cannot turn on Bluetooth from kid profiles and that is annoying when trying to connect wireless headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Mom

customer_reviews.title: Encourages kids to learn and interact with others!!
customer_reviews.text: It’s the best tablet I’ve ever bought for my 9 yo granddaughter. Within the first hour the product had paid for itself. She was reading out loud, excited about reading the next book, I’ve bought her other tablets before. And she liked them, alright. But this tablet encouraged her to do more than just watch videos, she actually wanted to learn and interact with me. She couldn’t wait to share it with her cousiand friends. Thank you amazon, for creating such great learning tool. I would, definitely, buy it again, and recommend it to my family and friends . Norma Turner, a very satisfied customet. P.S. I only wish I’d bought a few more on 7/16/18.
customer_reviews.author: Norma

customer_reviews.title: Great for toddler as it seems indestructible but needs better integration of apps between child profile and adult
customer_reviews.text: Love the durability. Tablet was dropped multiple times with no issues. Daughter loves the ability to choose her own entertainment as I feel safe they are appropriate for her under her profile. One star off for inability to transfer the downloaded videos or movies from apps or things saved into the tablet to be used under the child profile. Having to switch between profiles can become pretty annoying with a fickle toddler, unless I am missing something and you actually can? It would be great if you can as I've have some accidental purchases by the toddler. Luckily they were inexpensive kindle books.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: So perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter to keep her from being on my phone where I can't control what she does. This is perfect! I can control every single thing that she does on it and that she has access to. The worry free guarantee gives so much peace of mind. For those that wonder if the guarantee is legit, it is. I had to send ours in to be replaced and it was done with no questions asked and we got it in record time. The case that comes on it is soft foam, so if it's dropped it will be protected.
customer_reviews.author: Callie D.

customer_reviews.title: Kids love having their own devices and I love knowing that ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought during sale and definitely worth it. Kids love having their own devices and I love knowing that there is a 2 year warranty. Amazon did a great job with the setup in that it took maybe a minute or two to set it up and the kids were off and running. Different color cases help each kid know which is theirs. Really well done! Parental controls are good, but could be great. If there was a way to enter a parental override to allow extra time on a one time basis without switching to parent account, changing the amt, and then remembering to switch it back later.
customer_reviews.author: a reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Charging Issues
customer_reviews.text: Less than a year and this thing does not consistently charge. We have not used it a ton and it hasn't been damaged. Bought to November 2017 by July 2018 I had to send one back for replacement because it was not holding a charge and took three days to charge without any use because it was so slow!. The second one was sent back but I was told it was fine. NOW ITS DOING THE SAME AS THE OTHER ONE and not holding a charge. Sadly I cannot get the no questions asked repair option anymore. Also, I hate that you cannot block certain games and apps that you dont want your kid to play.
customer_reviews.author: G Dub

customer_reviews.title: Horrible horrrible horrible. Save your money!
customer_reviews.text: Trash! I bought this for my son in May and has stopped working. I have done factory reset after factory reset and my son can play on it for like 10 minutes before it completely stops working and he cannot press anything. I am then forced to reset the entire tablet for it to work for 10 minutes. I am highly upset with this product, I was excited for it because of the free play for my child and it would keep him occupied while we were out. In no way should this only work for 7 months and completely malfunction and stop working. Worst tablet I have ever bought EVER!!!! Shame on you amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Damaris Torres

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it. Clunky & slow. Battery defective.
customer_reviews.text: I like that the Kindle Fire is geared towards kids and the parental dashboard is awesome. However, compared to an iPad, it’s much slower and clunkier. My kid loves this though, so that’s all that matters. She enjoys the many free games, books and videos that come with the subscription. We have had this since August 2018 and it just died on us a few days ago. The battery will not hold a charge any longer. I think this one was defective since I bought my other kiddo one around the same time and the battery still works well.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: 2 year warranty total lie!
customer_reviews.text: My kids love the tablet! But it stopped turning on 8 months after using it. I called to get a replacement. “No questions asked” is totally FALSE! I spoke to a customer service representative and he didn’t even know what he was doing! I was on hold for a really long time. I thought I could just get a replacement but no; they need to find out who the manufacturer is and more about the warranty. Don’t let the 2 year warranty trick you into buying this device, it was a huge problem just trying to get some type of info. Doesn’t help that the customer service rep didn’t know much English.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: I love this tablet
customer_reviews.text: I love this tablet, and my daughter loves it as well. I would give it all 5 stars but I have two reasons why it fell a star behind. The downloaded games and shoes sometimes take a while to show on the screen when you first turn it on at times, and the biggest for me was there is no Spanish apps i can download on my toddlers account. Dora the explorer didn't even have apps in Spanish. I am currently trying to teach my daughter Spanish and have great apps on my phone but would have loved is the tablet could have been used for that..
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to set-up and comes with a lot of apps ...
customer_reviews.text: We have only had this item for a few days. The review is based on our experience so far. It was easy to set-up and comes with a lot of apps (some educational and many entertainment). My 8 year old loves it, she keeps saying it over and over again. The one thing that I am still trying to figure out if it is possible is how to put google play on her profile rather than mine. As of right now it won't let me put it on her profile do to parental settings. Therefore she has to log into my profile to use google play and log into hers for the other apps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: With alexa
customer_reviews.text: [Note: this review is being done by my 9_year_old son and I am choosing not to edit_ _please be kind ] it has a Amazon app store but not the best but it is good and Silk search bar and Alexa and Alexa hands free mode and a home screen password and Bluetooth and when you connect a alexa to it you can say alexa tell everybody it is dinner and it will do it it . It came with a kid proof case like blue and pink now it is hd that means hi def alexa has more camands and more wallpapers and more apps and that's it
customer_reviews.author: THowerton

customer_reviews.title: Eh, it's okay
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 5 year old. My kids loves it but I'm not thrilled with it. It freezes up at least once per use, requiring us to turn it off and back on again. I also don't love the Free Time thing. I'd rather have it like an iPad with different apps installed, that I can choose to control what she's playing with. We also can't get some of the apps that they use in her Kinder class. We are returning for a replacement in hopes of getting one that won't freeze up all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: No lock screen. Unfortunately
customer_reviews.text: Great product. But didn't solve my problem. It doesn't not have lock screen. So, baby just pushing all over menu. Leaving videos, games. Mess! Simple lock screen would solve.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Can't use other browsers
customer_reviews.text: Santa brought this tablet thinking that it could be used for the reading program that my son does at school. Unfortunately, the program can only be accessed through the chrome browser and this tablet only allows the use of the Silk browser. If Santa hadn't brought it, it would be on its way back to Amazon. Very disappointing. That said, other than this set of circumstances, it is a great device and I'm impressed with the free time app.
customer_reviews.author: penguin

customer_reviews.title: Buy it you won't regret it !
customer_reviews.text: Brought for my 3 year old, best purchase ever, we had to evacuate due to the hurricane and it kept him quite on a very stressful long drive, the apps are amazing, even has a clangers app! We are a kindle family and have many different generations, the only thing that upset me was the price was $99.99 and had to wait one more day till we could get it and literally logged on the next morning and it was $129.99 :( so upset we nearly didn't get it but glad we did !
customer_reviews.author: Vk

customer_reviews.title: Poor Battery
customer_reviews.text: This product was great the first day. I had issues with the battery life at first. Then the tablet did not charge at all. Amazon was great about replacing the item, however they sent me a regular Fire tablet, not a kid's edition one. I've been trying to find a way to contact Amazon without downloading the Amazon assistant and I am unable to. Very annoyed that I did not get a replacement of the device I actually purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia Kostin

customer_reviews.title: My only disappointment is that Amazon and Google don't play nicer
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this tablet and the subscription service that comes with it allows her access to a broad library of game, and related activities. I see her getting a full two to three years out f this device. It is well made and speedy. My only disappointment is that Amazon and Google don't play nicer. It would be wonderful, for example. to cast her tablet to my either one of my TVs. Also, the Amazon App store does not carry as many apps as the Play Store. So, this means that something you want may not be available. Overall, it is a great tablet and for how my daughter uses it, it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Sandberg

customer_reviews.title: FreeTime for the kids
customer_reviews.text: Trying to get this Kindle registered for an hour using my account. I keep getting an error. Can't find numbers on this website on how to get some customer support. Very frustrated. Update: I finally turned if off and back on and it was registered. Very weird. It seems to be working now just fine. Updating to 4 stars. I think the Free Time could be more user friendly and still can't figure out how to get customer service for the device when needed.
customer_reviews.author: N. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't turn on, wouldn't cover full return cost.
customer_reviews.text: We got this as a present for my daughter for Christmas. It would not turn on. Tried the hard restart multiple times, didn't work. So I have to pay $8.50 to send it back and only get reimbursed $4. So I'm in the hole 4.5 bucks because amazon can't QC their own products. I've never had a problem like this before, but it makes me think their product quality is being diminished over time. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Great content/terrible charging port issues
customer_reviews.text: I love the Fire tablets for the content that they have... but having purchased a half dozen (or more) of them from their conception, Amazon needs to fix the poor charging port issues!! I love Amazon’s customer service but who wants to have to return your child’s tablet every year to have the port fixed. Honestly, last year I simply bought new ones... sigh. My son is heartbroken that I need to return his tablet and it will be gone for a while. AMAZON, if you fix the port issues on the next generation, I will continue buying them... if not, I may just consider paying more and getting them an iPad.
customer_reviews.author: 2mommies

customer_reviews.title: Kids tablet review
customer_reviews.text: My stepdaughter liked the tablet but doesn’t seem to use it often. She did enjoy the educational games that came with it but seemed a little limited for tween. I would highly recommend this style of tablet for someone with younger kiddos as the case seems pretty hefty and able to handle abuse. If you’ve got an older kiddo, you can probably do the regular fire without paying extra for the kid version. I was not impressed with the auto enroll feature without my consent for freetime unlimited when the 1-yr included subscription ended. Make sure to cancel if you don’t want a recurring monthly charge for services not used.
customer_reviews.author: S. Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Refuses to charge
customer_reviews.text: Purchased November 25, 2017 for Christmas gift for Grandson. It's worked pretty well until this week, and it would have to be during summer break when I care for all the grandchildre. It has major charging issues. Have tried different chargers, but still cannot get above 3%. Thankfully, purchased with 2 year no worry guarantee. Since it hasn't been in stock for awhile, I hope it can be fixed or a newer one issued. Will be contacting customer service tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Miss ReadTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: This device must have perfect wi fi, bad purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Wi fi terrible on this device. You can not use it unless you have stronge wi fi. My iPad picks up wi fi and if I try this device using same wi fi no luck bad signal. Be warned must have perfect wi fi if you do not free time is useless and so is the kids pad. Bad purchase! Review were right I should have paid attention to them.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic purchase.
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these and are beyond happy with our choice. We have gone through several Nabi tablets, all which begin to fail rather quickly. We have had these tablets for 1-2 months and haven't had one single hiccup or problem with them. They came preloaded with a ton of games, all of which are child appropriate. There are books, movies, television shows, tons of games etc. This was easily the best purchase for our kids we've made in 2017. Would be an outstanding birthday or holiday present! The ONLY con is that they are veeeeery slow to charge, but to counter that, the battery life is very long.
customer_reviews.author: JillyBean

customer_reviews.title: Some serious annoying issues
customer_reviews.text: I HATE HOW MY CHILD CANNOT PLAY A GAME WITHOUT BEING OFFERED ANOTHER GAME IN THE MIDDLE. Seriously I paid for the tablet. I wish the maker would just allow a game to be played without butting in with another game ad leaving them unaware of how to get back to their original screen. This is really annoying and frustrating for young children. I spend tons of money on Amazon products but have not been happy with the tablets recently. Also the battery seems to drain a little quickly. I just upgraded this product from the smaller 7 (non-kids tablet) because of similar issues so I'm sad that this one doesn't seem better.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan L. Cornwell

customer_reviews.title: Just very disappointed in this device
customer_reviews.text: Not at all what i had expected. Actually thinking of sending it back. After turning ok device it does not go to child's profile automatically. Not able to play any games without wifi. Just very disappointed in this device. Better off getting a tablet through Verizon or your carrier and putting controls on that. Amazon needs to fix this profile design.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life.
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is a huge step up from our old 7” that was just a year old. The best thing is that the battery life is great. On old tablet we could barely drive 200 miles from home to Albuquerque and still have power. This makes the drive easily with power for another day in addition. The free time is wonderful and it is easier to download the shows he likes for those trips. Living almost 20 miles from work and grandma means it is used in the car a lot - and actually works well for those drives.
customer_reviews.author: Reader1

customer_reviews.title: Nice tablets
customer_reviews.text: We have had these for about 2 years now, both we bought ended up taking craps. One technical and one was sat on, not an issue! Which was great the 1st year the warranty covered both. Talked to tech support and within 10m had return labels sent to email and easily had these replaced. The tablets are good for use of games, books, streaming, really whatever you'd need. They are not laggy cheap tablets. Good buy especially when the have the buy 2 for deals!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the battery frustration.
customer_reviews.text: [After 3months] I wish the battery life was better. I noticed the screen turns on randomly and will not turn off. Very slow charging as well (I used multiple chargers). It's very frustrating after a full night of charging the battery managed to die down even when the tablet is not in use. Support was not helpful. I'm not sure how some people are able to download YouTube kids because I can't. The kids content overall I am happy with it. But honestly I don't think it was worth it. My Samsung seems to be a better fit for the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: These Kid's HD KINDLES-DO NOT LAST LONG...
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter only had it for a little over a year and the screen does not turn on anymore. I bought her another because Amazon will only replace for one year. Missed it by days... She is now 6 years old, so I am assuming and hoping that this will last a year and then it's time to buy her a ipad, no more baby toys with an adult price tag. Amazon...you need to extend the replacement time because...peole work hard to purchase these for their children/grandchildren.
customer_reviews.author: Kaiulani

customer_reviews.title: Ordered a 2-pack one was DOA
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of these as a package special. One was yellow and one blue. The the foam cover on these is very tough almost rubber like. The screen: nice and bright, very clear. There is an option to use this in parent mode which gives a traditional android type interface. When first starting the tablet it will enter childrens mode by default. This has been a useful tablet to keep around when youngsters are visiting. My only complaint giving 4 of 5 stars is that one was completely DOA wouldn't even accept a charge. Amazon was quick to arrange the return and issue a refund. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Baker

customer_reviews.title: The Fire HD 8 Kids Edition Table DOES NOT CHARGE AT ALL (NEW OUT OF THE BOX)
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tablet for my granddaughter in July 2017 and set it aside as a Christmas gift. I just returned from a visit with my granddaughter who lives out of state and learned that the Fire HD 8 Kids Edition Tablet 8 (Christmas gift) does not charge at all. The unit does not charge up at all. I am on the Amazon website and do not see where on the website to EXCHANGE the item that I purchased in July. Amazon ... Make the process hassle free for the consumer!
customer_reviews.author: Raven

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price!  Super satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for my preK-age children to replace their outdated cheapo tablets from a couple years ago. Very impressed with these tablets. Lightning fast, great screen, battery life is superb, and durable. One of the first things my son did was drop it and the foam cover completely protected the tablet. Even landed with a soft thud! Nice parental features like time limits and history review. I bought these with the intention of installing Google Play, but between Amazon and Netflix there's so much quality content I honestly don't need to. Plus, when the kids are sleeping, just switch profiles to my own and it's a fully functional normal tablet. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Richard T

customer_reviews.title: Seems durable
customer_reviews.text: The cover is very firm and a tight fit. The colors are bright and fun. I like all the parental settings although I still haven't figured out how to get the audio books to count for time for my son who hasn't learned to read yet. I was a little worried after reading the reviews of the two-packs that one would not work but both came in working condition and I haven't had any problems so far. My daughter gets a little frustrated because of the parental limitations that I set up, but all in all she likes it. I give it 4 stars only because of the audio book thing which wasn't covered in any instructions (which are minimal).
customer_reviews.author: JaDa Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great until it just quits staying charged at all
customer_reviews.text: This tablet was great at first. Our son loved all of the AMAZON free time aps. There was a great selection of learning aps. It held up well with it's thick shock proof case. It was easy to clean of sticky fingers prints. However, just under a year in the battery quit holding a charge until eventually right over a year it quit charging or turning on at all. I guess that I shouldn't complain much for the price. Everything electronic seems to have a limited life now days that coincides with when the warranty runs out. Just a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Mustlovedogs

customer_reviews.title: threw it out his bedroom window and ricocheted it off his bedroom walls and it STILL worked great. After 3 years I figured it was time ...
customer_reviews.text: My autistic boy had the smaller version of this and it lasted him 3 years before it started going downhill a bit. In that time he threw it from a car going 65 mph, tossed it into the sink full of water and dishes several times, tossed it down stairs, threw it out his bedroom window and ricocheted it off his bedroom walls and it STILL worked great. After 3 years I figured it was time for an upgrade. Partially because he deserves it and partially because the company does. When they say durable, they mean it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Dunford

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome for kids
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome for kids. I was nervous about how well the cases would work. My 3 year old daughter is a firecracker and has thrown them and actually hit her brother's with them... They all still work! We've had them for about 6 months. I also love that I can control so much of the content they have access to. The perfect tablet for kids. P. S. They go in sale every couple of months.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Soso
customer_reviews.text: In all honesty this thing is over priced. Works fairly but cluttered amazon over android is horrible. Hard to find true educational games and videos for our daughter. Battery life is truly about 7hrs. Otherwise it's a decent unit. Cons Overlay, lack of quality education for freetime. ( there may be some just hard to find.), lots of the games etc want you to purchase or ads. Which I refuse any child app that has those features. They are a disgrace when pushing stuff to our kids. No I would not buy it again. Even though the daughter loves using it.
customer_reviews.author: AsWangs

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet plagued with charging issues...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 2 year old son.. he has it for a year now and as far back as I can remember there is always problem getting the battery to charge. Once it goes dead it takes years to come on and sometimes the charging signal is on and it's actually not charging. I changed the charging chord and all of that. A plus though is it's great battery life. I don't know if I'm the only one facing these issues but it seems to be common amongst purchasers. Very energy efficient, little to no system failure but the charging issue is a major turn off.
customer_reviews.author: Caseous Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Best kids’ tablet ever!!
customer_reviews.text: Love the various apps and versatility of this tablet. The cover is durable and withstands the abuse that accompanies small children. I’ve ourchased 6 of these and will continue to purchase Kindles over other pricier brands. The warranty can’t be beat and performance is amazing for our needs. Educational and entertainment apps are constantly being added so there is a seemingly endless supply of new material. I can access Amazon music, Alexa, Prime video, shopping, everything I need from Amazon. Love that I can take this on the road for viewing videos. Screen is large enough for viewing but tablet is compact enough for transportability. Love love love Amazon Kindle Kids Edition!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly W

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this tablet
customer_reviews.text: This tablet comes with a 2 year warranty and I have 2 of them this is the third time having to get replacements, twice because of broken screen. The tablet includes a 2 year unlimited warranty but they will do everything they can to not uphold it and will say your warranty is up when it isn't. Have had problems with it not charging properly, lagging, tablet keeps saying its not connected to the internet and won't let her use the content we pay for. I would not recommend this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Wanted something with good parental controls but enough for my child to use
customer_reviews.text: Wanted something with good parental controls but enough for my child to use. This is the best of both worlds. My son was a little disappointed he couldn't do YouTube on this, BUT I can add specific YouTube videos to his profile. So he just cants search and freely watch YouTube. I have to approve each individual video, but that's what I like about it. Tons of games, books, apps, videos and if is perfect! Also has the adult profile version so when he grows out of the kid version, I'll just make him an adult profile on the tablet!
customer_reviews.author: Lilac28

product_meta.title: Fire HD 8 Kids Edition Tablet, 8" HD Display, 32 GB, Pink Kid-Proof Case (Previous Generation - 7th)
feature_bullets: Up to $144 in savings on Fire HD 8 tablet, 1 year of Amazon FreeTime Unlimited, and a Kid-Proof Case, versus items purchased separately ─ plus a 2-year worry-free guarantee
Not a toy, a full-featured Fire HD 8 tablet with a vibrant HD display, 32 GB internal storage, and up to 12 hours of mixed-use battery life. Add a microSD card for up to 256 GB of expandable storage.

The included 1 year of FreeTime Unlimited gives your kids access to 15,000 popular apps and games, videos, books, and educational content from PBS Kids, Nickelodeon, Disney, and more. Your subscription will then automatically renew every month starting at just $2.99 per month plus applicable tax. You may cancel at any time by visiting the Amazon Parent Dashboard or contacting Customer Service
2-year worry-free guarantee: if they break it, return it and we'll replace it for free. No questions asked.
One year of FreeTime Unlimited gives you access to 15,000 popular apps and games, videos, books, and educational content from PBS Kids, Nickelodeon, Disney, and more
Add even more content to your child’s profile in FreeTime to give them selected access to apps in your personal library, such as Netflix, YouTube, and Minecraft

Easy-to-use parental controls allow parents to personalize screen time limits, set educational goals, filter age-appropriate content, and also manage web browsing and content usage. Parental controls can be set on device or online through Amazon Parent Dashboard. Additionally, access all tablet features in the adult profile by entering your passcode.
Amazon Parent Dashboard with Discussion Cards enables parents to discover the titles their kids enjoy and connect with them through rich conversations about these titles
